intro: Acritopappus morii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are typically clustered in a head, surrounded by bracts. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with its deep root system and reduced leaf surface. Acritopappus morii is often found in sandy soils and is a valuable plant for ecological restoration in desert ecosystems.
